member.name: T:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.AuthType
member.summary: The enumeration is used to specify the authentication method to use on a connection.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.AuthType.Anonymous
member.summary: Indicates that the connection should be made without passing credentials. The value is equal to 0.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.AuthType.Basic
member.summary: Indicates that basic authentication should be used on the connection. The value is equal to 1.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.AuthType.Digest
member.summary: Indicates that the Digest Access Authentication should be used on the connection. The value is equal to 4.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.AuthType.Dpa
member.summary: Indicates that Distributed Password Authentication (DPA) should be used on the connection. The value is equal to 6.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.AuthType.External
member.summary: Indicates an external method will be used to authenticate the connection. The value is equal to 8.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.AuthType.Kerberos
member.summary: Indicates that Kerberos authentication should be used on the connection. The value is equal to 9.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.AuthType.Msn
member.summary: Indicates that it is authenticated by “Microsoft Network Authentication Service”. The value is equal to 7.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.AuthType.Negotiate
member.summary: Indicates that Microsoft Negotiate authentication should be used on the connection. The value is equal to 2.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.AuthType.Ntlm
member.summary: Indicates that Windows NT Challenge/Response (NTLM) authentication should be used on the connection. The value is equal to 3.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.AuthType.Sicily
member.summary: Indicates a negotiation mechanism (Sicily) will be used to choose MSN, DPA or NTLM. This should be used for LDAPv2 servers only. The value is equal to 5.

member.summary: Dereferences aliases when locating the base object, but not when searching its subordinates. The value is equal to 2.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DereferenceAlias.InSearching
member.summary: Dereferences aliases when searching subordinates of the base object, but not when locating the base itself. The value is equal to 1.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DereferenceAlias.Never
member.summary: Does not dereference aliases. The value is equal to 0.

member.summary: No options used. The value equals 0 or 0x0.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectorySynchronizationOptions.ObjectSecurity
member.summary: If this option is used, the caller requires no rights, but can only view objects and attributes that are accessible to the caller. If this option is not used, the caller must have the replicate changes right. The value equals 1 or 0x1.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectorySynchronizationOptions.ParentsFirst
member.summary: Return parents before children, when parents would otherwise appear later in the replication stream. The value equals 2048 or 0x800.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectorySynchronizationOptions.PublicDataOnly
member.summary: Do not return private data in search results. The value equals 8192 or 0x2000.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ErrorResponseCategory.Other

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ErrorResponseCategory.UnresolvableUri
member.summary: The client provider is unable to resolve the URI to a value that can transferred to the server. The value is equal to 6.

member.name: T:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LocatorFlags
member.summary: The enumeration specifies data required to locate a domain controller.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LocatorFlags.AvoidSelf
member.summary: Specifies that the domain controller returned should not be the current computer. The value is equal to 16384 or 0x4000.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LocatorFlags.DirectoryServicesPreferred
member.summary: Attempts to find a domain controller that supports directory service functions (Windows 2000 or later). The value is equal to 32 or 0x20.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LocatorFlags.DirectoryServicesRequired
member.summary: Requires that the returned domain controller support Windows 2000 or later. The value is equal to 16 or 0x10.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LocatorFlags.ForceRediscovery
member.summary: Forces the cached domain controller to be ignored. The value is equal to 1 or 0x1.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LocatorFlags.GCRequired
member.summary: Requires that the returned domain controller be a global catalog server for the forest of domains with this domain as the root. The value is equal to 64 or 0x40.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LocatorFlags.GoodTimeServerPreferred
member.summary: Attempts to find a domain controller that is a reliable time server. The value is equal to 8192 or 0x2000.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LocatorFlags.IPRequired
member.summary: Sets the Internet protocol address of the domain controller in the DomainControllerAddress member of DomainControllerInfo. The value is equal to 512 or 0x200.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LocatorFlags.IsDnsName
member.summary: Specifies that the DomainName parameter is a DNS name. The value is equal to 131072 or 0x20000.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LocatorFlags.IsFlatName
member.summary: Specifies that the DomainName parameter is a flat name. The value is equal to 65536 or 0x10000.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LocatorFlags.KdcRequired
member.summary: Requires that the returned domain controller be currently running the Kerberos Key Distribution Center service. The value is equal to 1024 or 0x400.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LocatorFlags.None
member.summary: No data required. The value is equal to 0 or 0x0.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LocatorFlags.OnlyLdapNeeded
member.summary: Specifies that the server returned is an LDAP server. The value is equal to 32768 or 0x8000.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LocatorFlags.PdcRequired
member.summary: Requires that the returned domain controller be the primary domain controller for the domain. The value is equal to 128 or 0x80.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LocatorFlags.ReturnDnsName
member.summary: Specifies that the name returned should be a DNS name. The value is equal to 1073741824 or 0x40000000.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LocatorFlags.ReturnFlatName
member.summary: Specifies that the name should be a flat name. The value is equal to 2147483648 or 0x80000000.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LocatorFlags.TimeServerRequired
member.summary: Requires that the returned domain controller be currently running the Windows Time Service. The value is equal to 2048 or 0x800.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LocatorFlags.WriteableRequired
member.summary: Requires that the returned domain controller be writable. The value is equal to 4096 or 0x1000.

member.summary: The enumeration specifies if and how referral chasing is pursued.

member.summary: Chase referrals of either the subordinate or external type. The value is equal to 96 or 0x60.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ReferralChasingOptions.External
member.summary: Chase external referrals. The value is equal to 64 or 0x40.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ReferralChasingOptions.None
member.summary: Never chase the referred-to server. Setting this option prevents a client from contacting other servers in a referral process. The value is equal to 0 or 0x0.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ReferralChasingOptions.Subordinate
member.summary: Chase only subordinate referrals which are a subordinate naming context in a directory tree. The ADSI LDAP provider always turns off this flag for paged searches. The value is equal to 32 or 0x20.
